title: Is Thornmail doing its job?
body:
Thornmail is a very unique and situational item that is available to pretty much only one class of champions _(Tanks)_.

But when we ask ourselves: What does Thornmail actually do?
What is the answer?

I have always believed it to be a deterrent item. You buy it to make the enemy AA champion think twice about attacking you.

But is it actually doing that? Is it actually punishing the enemy enough to make them hesitant to attack you?
Personally, I don't think so.

The only time you ever really buy thornmail is if there is an enemy who does the majority of their damage from auto attacks _(usually crits)_. 
But virtually every champion that is worth you buying thornmail against, also naturally builds lots of lifesteal.

So all thornmail ends up doing, is nullifying some of their lifesteal.
It's not actually acting as a deterrent anymore, it's just more of an inconvenience to them.


So this is thornmail's effect:
Deals 25% bonus armour + 15% of incoming damage from basic attacks, back to the attacker as magic damage.

Now most AA champions have more than 15% lifesteal _(most ADC's have 20% just from 1 item alone)_. So already they are life-stealing back more health than is being dealt by thornmail.

So if we have an AA based champion: Lets say Caitlin, her Auto attacks do 800 damage. 
Leona has Thornmail.
Caitlin has Bloodthirster.

So of 800 damage
120 (15%) is being returned as magic damage.
160 (20%) is being healed as lifesteal.

So Caitlin's health is going up by 40 per auto attack.

So now lets add in the bonus armour part of Thornmail's effect. 
Lets say that Leona has 218 armour, _(2 armour items including Thornmail)_

218 - 88 _(her base armour)_ = 130
25% of 130 is 33

So thats 33 more damage that Thornmail is doing.

40 - 33 = 7

Which means, overall, Caitlin _gains_ 7 health per auto.

Her lifesteal completely nullifies the effect of Thornmail.

______

Now the clever cookies among us will be saying _"Ahhh but Thornmail deflects the damage **before** reduction, Lifesteal gives you hp based on the damage **after** reduction."_
And they'd be right!

But the armour reduction calculation is far more complex than my feeble mind is willing to endure, so I've left it simple for this post. 
Which means that my above calculation is technically incorrect, but it demonstrates my point!
and my rebuttal to all this, is that with 1 extra lifesteal item _(lets pretend, Bloodthirster and Botrk, not to mention runes/masteries,)_ the champion's lifesteal vastly outheals any damage done by Thornmail even with the proper armour reduction.

So in essence, all Thornmail becomes is just a Grevious Wounds item with 100 armour, that only affects lifesteal.

It in no way deters champions like Trynd/Cait/Draven/Yasuo/Vayne etc etc. from attacking. 
Which are the main champions that you'd buy it to defend against.

_______

I personally think that Thornmail needs a little buff, something that will make Vayne or Trynd think twice about 3 hitting your tanks.
Maybe actually add some form of Grevious Wounds onto Thornmail's existing passive (with a slight reduction of damage of course). 
Make it like Sterak's, _"After receiving X amount of damage from auto attacks from a single champion, applies Grevious wounds to the attacker for 0.5 seconds after each auto."_ Or something similar.

What do you all think?
Is Thornmail doing a good enough job of defending us from Vayne/Trynd/Yas/Draven/Cait etc etc?

**[edit]:** Not to mention that a large portion of AA damage is now done though on hit and crit effects like Bloodrazor, Shiv, Botrk, etc. And I don't believe Thornmail offers any protection against that.
